p: D. draco subsp. ajgal is located in the Assif Oumaghouz mountain in the Anti-Atlas (Benabid and Cuzin 1997), participates in an original and endemic association constituted by Davallio canariensis-Dracaenetum ajgal Benabid and Cuzin 1997. It is characterized by D. draco subsp. ajgal, which is an endemic and very rare sub-species (Fennane and Ibn Tattou 1998), D. canariensis and various endemics. According to Médail and Quézel ( 1999) the population of D. draco subsp. ajgal is representative case for North Africa of a refuge for tertiary flora. However, a recent study (Durán et al. 2020) claimed that D. draco subsp. ajgal may be a taxon at early stages of speciation differentiated from the island source area.
